intro: Mitrasacme alsinoides var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
